page.title: 14The Cat and Man Legend.
page.content: When they reached St. Helens stream, Winifred made a tremendous leap, but failed and fell headlong into the water.Sir Percival was thrown to the ground and the wild cat flew at him.A terrible struggle ensued, and blood flowed from both man and cat.They struggled on up the hill to Barnburgh, reaching the churchyard and finally the church porch.Weak from his terrible ordeal, Sir Percival fell dying, as he fell he crushed the cat against the wall of the porch and killed it.Sir Percival's servant, somewhat alarmed when Winifred arrived back at The Hall riderless and covered in blood, set off to search for his master.He found Sir Percival dying in the church porch. The church porch floor still carries the blood stains. So the man killed the cat, and the cat killed the man.
